result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latrell G Brantley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Latrell G Brantley appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Latrell G Brantley.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status of counsel.  Attorney Patrick Wait appointed and is waiting for discovery and an offer.  Court scheduled another status conference.  Zoom appearances approved by the Court for the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-31-2022
Received and Filed: Attorney Patrick Wait

Defendant Latrell G Brantley in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Latrell G Brantley.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court a status conference.  Attorney Krejci moves to withdraw as counsel due to a conflict of interest.  Court grants Attorney Krejci's motion and schedules a status of counsel date.  State Public Defender's Office notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Latrell G Brantley in court, appear by video.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for status following co-defendant Darenz Haynes 22CF1822. Case is adjourned to Br. 2.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered co-defendants be kept separate while in custody.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with L.M.S. or the residence at 6401 W. Florist Ave; co-defs: Darenz Haynes, J.G.J
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Latrell G Brantley in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Latrell G Brantley in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Latrell G Brantley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
